title: SaltStack Salt API auth bypass + path traversal chain
summary: Unauthenticated access to the Salt master’s publisher (CVE-2020-11651) enabled attackers to call internal methods; combined with path traversal in the REST and wheel modules (CVE-2020-11652), this yielded arbitrary file read/write and code execution against masters and minions.

title: GitLab preauth RCE via ExifTool chain
summary: GitLab’s file uploads passed user-controlled images to ExifTool; a crafted DjVu file triggered a Perl module injection bug in ExifTool (CVE-2021-22204), which GitLab exposed pre-auth as RCE (CVE-2021-22205).

title: Zimbra mailbox chain: file upload to auth bypass
summary: Attackers used an unauthenticated servlet upload bug to write JSPs (CVE-2022-27925); later, an auth bypass in Zimbra’s mboximport servlet (CVE-2022-37042) enabled pre-auth exploitation at scale.

title: Apache httpd path traversal → RCE chain
summary: An initial path traversal in Apache httpd (CVE-2021-41773) permitted reading files outside the document root; incomplete patching led to CVE-2021-42013 enabling RCE via CGI script execution on certain configurations.

title: Jenkins Script Security sandbox escape chain
summary: Multiple flaws in Jenkins Script Security and Pipeline plugins allowed sandboxed Groovy to escape, culminating in RCE on controllers via crafted Jenkinsfiles and CPS transformers.

title: Apache OFBiz unauth RCE + patch bypass
summary: A pre-auth RCE in OFBiz’s XML-RPC endpoint (CVE-2023-49070) was patched, but insufficiently; CVE-2023-51467 bypassed the fix, restoring unauthenticated code execution.

title: Apache Guacamole RDP gateway chain
summary: Memory corruption and input validation bugs in guacd’s RDP handling (CVE-2020-9497 and CVE-2020-9498) allowed an attacker controlling an upstream RDP server to achieve RCE in the Guacamole gateway and pivot to connected clients.

title: Adobe Commerce/Magento 2 pre-auth RCE chain
summary: A pre-auth input validation flaw (CVE-2022-24086) enabled code execution in Magento/Adobe Commerce; a subsequent patch-bypass (CVE-2022-24087) restored exploitation, enabling cart- and checkout-adjacent RCE.
